attributes.action: Advise all MPs that we will not vote for them again if they dishonour Brexit.
attributes.additional_details: Recent Parliamentary votes have stated that Parliament seek to revoke the law thereby dishonouring manifesto pledges to abide by the 2016 Brexit referendum vote result.
attributes.background: The UK government's two-years notice under Article 50 of The Treaty on European Union takes effect on 29 March 2019. The petitioners pledge not to vote for existing MPs of any party in any future election if this law is not complied in full or amended in any way

rejection.details: It's up to individuals to decide how they vote in an election.
